name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Arosa

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location, just off of the Gran Via, and the rate was very reasonable, for about $80/night. The rooms are clean but basic, and upon request there is a shuttle directly from the airport for a nominal fee. The staff was helpful, the wifi was free. The one thing I didn´t like was that breakfast wasn´t included in the room rate, and was very expensive at 11 euros, as was the room service itself. Nevertheless I´d probaably stay here again.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, not a bad price

reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location, right on the Gran Via. Mass transit stations are nearby, but much of the city is within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is in good shape and the rooms are of decent size, for European standards. The staff, although helpful, spoke very little English.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel in Good Location

likes.liked: — Location, location, location...............did I mention location?

reviews.title: Could have done better!

reviews.text: All 3 rooms looked out onto the court of the hotel which wasn't the best of views. But we didn't mind too much as we didn't intend on stopping too long in the rooms anyway.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom was larger than most that I've encountered and was spotless. The shower was very powerful.
reviews.title: You GEt what you pay for

reviews.text: The Arosa was in the best location, right off Grand Via! It made shopping and walking to popular tourist sites (Grand Via, Sol, Palace, etc.) very convenient. The hotel was very clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was quite nice and was a step above continental, although I wish the food options would have changed just a bit from day to day. The room was small, but quite normal as most standard rooms in Europe are smaller than in the USA; however it was clean with modern furnishings and an updated bathroom. The elevators were quite small and very oddly shaped. One elevator was in the shape of a triangle which made traveling with a lot of luggage very difficult. I am not sure how they accommodate people with disabilities and I recommend the stairs for people that are claustrophobic. With that being said, the major drawback in my opinion was the heating/air conditioning system. At the time we visited Madrid, it was colder than usual (12-17C) and the heating system had been shut off to run the air. Therefore, we froze for the 3 nights we were there. It didn't warm up in Madrid until the 4th day and we were checking out. But oddly enough, the common areas (hall, lobby, etc) were all warmer than our room. My suggestion is to make sure if you stay at the Arosa, you travel during periods where if you need air, you can have air, but if you need heat, you can get heat - we didn't have that luxury!
reviews.title: The Arosa was a GREAT find!

reviews.text: my grandaughter and i stayed at this hotel on june for six nights we where really pleased with our room we had a nice veiw of the grand via with two french doors and a tiny balcony that we could stand i would stay there again. smcarr katy texas
reviews.title: loved this place

reviews.text: This is in no way a "style" or "boutique" hotel but it has everything you need for a stress-free trip to Madrid.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: The rooms are very clean and have the essential AC and double glazing (Madrid is loud!). The bathrooms are large and our room had a balcony - good if your other half is a smoker!
reviews.title: Great Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff efficient and helpful - we needed to print something which they couldn't do but pointed us in the right direction.
reviews.title: Value for money when under 70 euros

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel and I can't think of a better location for those looking to do sightseeing, shopping and bar crawling. Metro station is 2 blocks away, internet cafe, everything you can think of. The reception staff and porters were very helpful. The only downside is housekeeping, as I had to call reception at 10 pm to ask for toilet paper! and in spite of hanging the towels on the rails (as indicated to save water), they were changed 3 times, but the glasses for drinking water were left dirty for 3 days.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Note that the hotel is not really modern and in general rooms are pretty basic, without any spectacular views or flat screen tv, but the price is very reasonable and if you are planning on spending any more than 8 hours in your room, then you are wasting your time in Madrid.
reviews.title: Great Value! No Complaints

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through expedia and got a really good price for it...
reviews.title: Quite grand!!

reviews.title: great location, very clean room, free internet

reviews.text: Room was great considering we got it so cheap, had air con and TV and a safe in the room...
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.title: Decent hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Madrid fab city. Stay away from drinking in the Plaza Major as it costs a fortune. Good bars and tapas bars around the Plaza Santa Ana and not as expensive! This is about 5/10 mins walk away. can walk around the city easily.
reviews.title: Great location, great value for money, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had breakfast in a couple fo different coffee shops for about 2 or 3 euros. Lots of palces to eat and drink.
reviews.title: 2 and a half star hotel with GREAT location

reviews.text: Got a shuttle bus from the hotel back to the airport for 12 euros pp. Cheaper than a taxi, but more expensive than the underground.
reviews.title: Superb location. Good value. Free wifi throughout hotel. Friendly staff

reviews.text: Great rates in excellent location, booked 3 nights for 50euro/night on expedia, spacious enough with a small balcony, free wifi, desk, brand new bathroom, wooden flooring, perfect for business, i got the same rates as somebody staying 20km out of the centre, would stay there again, ask for one of the new, refurbished rooms. if you're looking to spend a lot of time in the room this might not be for you, ps don't have breakfast in the hotel, there are plenty of great cafes around charging less than 2euro for an authentic spanish breakfast. the staff is not as friendly but this is spain :)
reviews.title: Basic, but great location and good value!

reviews.text: I only had 1 night in Madrid and am glad I chose the Best Western Arosa. The hotel is a great location and very close to the Gran Via metro stop. The wireless internet and tasty breakfast were included so it made it even more worthwhile. The rooms are not large, but not tiny either.
reviews.title: Nice stay - worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue I had was that the room was warm so I turned on the AC and set to the lowest setting and put the fan on high. I was still warm so opened the window to let cool air in. I was sitting on the bed next to the window and got up an hour later and the room was even hotter. Turns out that even though I had the thermostat set to 10 and AC on, the heat was actually on and making the room hotter. Once I turned the thermostat off, the room cooled down with the open window.
reviews.title: Great location in Madrid

reviews.text: Also, if you are coming from the airport via the metro, be careful if you have luggage. You have to transfer trains 2 times which isn't bad unless you have some big luggage because there are about 2-3 sets of stairs. I only had a small bag so it was no problem but if you had a large suitcase it would be inconvenient.
reviews.title: Great Location and Clean, but Staff is Indifferent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in April for a friends birthday and found it to be a great location for heading out into La Latina and Cheuca. Rooms were clean and comfortable and good value. Breakfast was also very good and included in the price of the room. We would definately check into to Hotel Arosa when we are next in Madrid.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, right off Gran Via and very close to the major sight seeing areas of Old Madrid. I was also very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the new fixtures and decor. I travel a lot for work and stay in hotels every week. I usually don't expect much from the hotel staff. I just like a nice place to sleep and that's about it. However, I distinctly noticed that the hotel staff is not friendly or welcoming. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had to go to the front desk a few times. Not once did any of the hotel staff smile or make me feel welcome. I felt more like I was inconveniencing them. For this reason, I am giving the hotel 3 stars instead of 4.
reviews.title: Just location worth the price

reviews.text: This hotel doesn't stand out - either as exceptionally good - or bad. It has a great location close to Gran Via and was quiet (had a room facing the back yard). We found BW Arosa a good base for exploring Madrid during a girls weekend.
reviews.title: Ok for a Weekend Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a little tired (carpet, curtains, painting) and there was absolutely no luxury at all. The in room safe was a mystery but eventually we managed to figure it out. Breakfast met all our needs and the bar was a good place to rest the feet or have a drink before dinner.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: The elevators at this hotel are really tiny - if someone had even the smallest suitcase (often the case at hotels ...) we had to wait or take turns going up or down, a bit irritating of course.
reviews.title: 2 star hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel Arosa is ideal for a visit to Madrid. It is very central and an easy trip from the airport on the Metro (Gran Via station 100m) - provided you prepare your route and know that you must change lines twice - at €2 it's not a problem. The location is ideal for exploring central Madrid on foot, with most tourist attractions within easy reach. There is some street noise but what the heck - look at the location. This area of the city is buzzing with hoards of people around day band night, traffic jams at 4am, beggars, prostitutes and pickpockets – none of which caused us any problems.
reviews.title: Not too bad, but ..."

reviews.text: We chose an executive room deal which included breakfast, free mini-bar, pay TV (we didn’t use it), Wifi, bathrobes and slippers. The room was on the 5th floor and was spacious, clean and had been renovated with a modern appearance. The staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: great location for sleepless nights

reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.title: Great spot to stay in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Perfect Location

likes.disliked: — Thin walls.. although, not bothered about it.

reviews.text: Our room rate included breakfast which was of a poor standard. It consisted of unpeeled fruit, bread, cereal, coffee, yogurt and miso soup/rice. The hotel has a restaurant which is a sushi restaurent. There did not appear to be any room service.
reviews.title: Great Location, would stay again
Great Location
reviews.text: Our first time staying in Madrid, my wife and I selected this hotel for it's location. We stayed 3 nights and used 2 rooms since we had 4 in our party. We had rooms on the third floor, which only has 4 rooms total, so it has the potential to be very quiet. The rooms were nicely decorated, ie. laminate wood floor (Pergo?), high ceilings, huge headboards and a modern bath (the lack of a shower curtain takes some getting used to. Instead they have a "half" glass door). The room had a thermostat, but did not seem to change the temperature much. (Outside temp was 65 in day, and 50's at night). The walls in the rooms seemed thin and noise from your neighbors can easily be heard (and vice-versa). Cable TV was very limited in channel selection for English speaking stations.

reviews.title: Clean hotel in good location for a great price
reviews.text: The hotel is essentially on Gran Via, but fronts to a side street. It is conveniently located and an easy walk to shopping, restaurants, Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. The hotel is also fairly close to the Metro lines. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning, however, it is expensive (13 Euros per person). In our case it was not included in our room rate and was an added expense. The staff at the desk spoke broken English, so we were fortunate that I speak Spanish. I would not hesitate to stay here again, however, next time we'll eat breakfast at the local coffee shop and save our Euros.

reviews.title: Noise
reviews.text: Generally speaking we enjoyed our vacation in Spain. My suggestion to others - be prepared to spend "muchos Euros" while in Spain since nothing is cheap there.

reviews.title: Good Value for Central Location
reviews.text: The Arosa is very centrally located in Madrid, and an excellent value for a clean, modern hotel in such a location. Our price (prepaid at around $100/night) included the buffet/continental breakfast each morning. Fairly simple, but the food was decent and coffee plentiful.

reviews.title: Great location but noisy
reviews.text: Our only complaint was a very hard mattress, but I suppose that's to be expected in some places (and in fact, is preferred by some travellers). Our room faced a courtyard area, so we didn't have the noise issues of other reviewers. Overall, a nice place at a great price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located for exploring central Madrid and beyond since it is very close to Gran Via metro station. The hotel very clean and well-maintained.
reviews.title: Pretty average-in no hurry to go back

reviews.text: The lifts are extremely small and odd-shaped, making it difficult to fit both people and luggage inside. This is particularly problematic if you are on an upper level, where using the stairs isn't an attractive option. We visited during a quiet time but I'd imagine this would be a bigger problem during peak holiday periods. Also, the room was uncomfortably warm (in February!) due to the heating system being left on constantly and the air conditioning switched off. This meant that we had to (try to) sleep with the window open but remained uncomfortable through the night. It would have been good to be able to control this or at least have been advised of the situation.
reviews.title: Super Location but not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for Shopping and nightlife.The bedrooms are basic but clean not as noisey as expected.Generelly we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Strangest lift i have ever been in.
reviews.title: good hotel - excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for 2 nights. The location of this Hotel is excellent, not far from anywhere. 5 mins walk from Plaza del Sol and 1 min walk from Gran Via. A bit noisy, could hear traffic and room next door, but room size was good. Didn't take breakfast, 14euro each, you could get a coffee and croissant in the bar/cafe over the road for 3euro for 2 people! Nowhere is far in Madrid, you could get to the Prado from the hotel in 20 mins walk, to the Palace in 10 mins, the best way to see the City... walk it.
reviews.title: Perfect location...has everything you need!

reviews.text: I stayed in the Arosa for 3nights with my boyfriend. As young people we were not that fussy and only expected the basics but were delighted to have a luxurious stay here.
reviews.title: perfect value for money
